1 class PID:
2 
3  def __init__(self, Kp, Ki, Kd):
4  self.prev_error = 0
5  self.proportional = 0
6  self.integral = 0
7  self.derivative = 0
8  self.Kp = Kp
9  self.Ki = Ki
10  self.Kd = Kd
11 
12  self.target = 0
13 
14  @staticmethod
15  def constrain(value, lower_limit, higher_limit):
16  if value < lower_limit: value = lower_limit
17  if value > higher_limit: value = higher_limit
18  return value
19 
20  def control(self, current, dt):
21  dt = dt.to_sec()
22  error = float(current - self.target)
23  self.proportional = error * self.Kp
24  self.integral += PID.constrain(error * dt * self.Ki, -100, 100)
25  self.derivative = (error - self.prev_error) / dt * self.Kd
26  self.prev_error = error
27  return PID.constrain(self.proportional + self.integral + self.derivative, -100, 100)
28 
29  def break_pid(self):
30  self.proportional = 0
31  self.integral = 0
32  self.derivative = 0
33 
34  def set_target(self, target):
35  if target != self.target:
36  self.break_pid
37  self.target = target
38 
39  def set_gains(self, P, I, D):
40  self.Kp = P
41  self.Ki = I
42  self.Kd = D
